intro: Calceolaria bullata, commonly known as the hairy slipper orchid, is a striking flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are often brightly colored, with a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, tubular blooms that can range in color from violet to red, depending on the species. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Calceolaria bullata is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is known for its delicate, hairy leaves that give it its common name.
